channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Segway's updated Ninebot Kickscooter Max is $100 off for Earth Day
item.description: Save big on Segway's Ninebot Kickscooter Max G30LP at Wellbots for Earth Day.

item.title: Fujifilm and Nintendo team up on a Switch-themed Instax printer
item.description: Fujifilm has launched a new Instax Mini Link smartphone printer variant with colors that may remind you of the Nintendo Switch.

item.title: High Hopes plans to extract atmospheric CO2 with hot air balloons
item.description: Freezing CO2 is easier just below the stratosphere.

item.title: The Morning After: NASA's Perseverance rover is making oxygen on Mars
item.description: Today’s headlines: PlayStation Plus could soon include a video service, NASA's Perseverance rover turns a tiny bit of Mars air into breathable oxygen and Samsung’s gadget Upcycling beta comes to the US.

item.title: Microsoft and the UK will build the world's 'most powerful' weather supercomputer
item.description: The Met Office has stuck a multi-million pound agreement with Microsoft to build the UK's fastest supercomputer to predict weather and climate forecasts.

item.title: Garmin's Venu 2 smartwatches offer sleep scores and health snapshots
item.description: Garmin has unveiled the Venu 2 and smaller Venu 2S fitness-oriented smartwatches with a host of extra health features over the original Venu model.

item.title: Google's Live Caption feature comes to Chromebooks
item.description: Google is adding its auto-generating Live Caption system to Chromebooks by way of a new Chrome OS release.

item.title: Signal hacked Cellebrite's phone hacking software used by law enforcement
item.description: After the cellphone hacking company Cellebrite said it had figured out a way to access the secure messaging app Signal, Signal said that it's turning the tables.

item.title: Twitter is testing professional profiles for businesses
item.description: Twitter has started testing its redesigned profile for businesses that allows owners to display more information potential customers can see.

item.title: Tesla's solar panels and Powerwall batteries are becoming a package deal
item.description: Elon Musk said that starting next week, if you want a Tesla solar setup, you'll have to order a Powerwall battery too.

item.title: The US Postal Service is monitoring social media for 'inflammatory' postings
item.description: According to Yahoo News, the Postal Service's law enforcement arm — the United States Postal Inspection Service or USPIS — has been running a surveillance program called the Internet Covert Operations Program (iCOP).

item.title: Disney's new deal with Sony gets Spider-Man flicks on Disney+
item.description: Sony already had a streaming deal with Netflix, but now it has a new agreement with Disney that locks in films for Disney+ and Hulu.

item.title: 'Resident Evil 4' comes out on Oculus Quest 2 this year
item.description: As promised, Oculus had new details to share about the upcoming VR remaster of Resident Evil 4.

item.title: 'Lone Echo II' heads to Oculus VR this summer
item.description: Here's a highlight of some of the more notable announcements from Facebook's first Oculus Gaming Showcase.

item.title: NASA's Perseverance rover turns a tiny bit of Mars air into breathable oxygen
item.description: On April 20th, Perseverance successfully pulled carbon dioxide from the planet's atmosphere and converted it into oxygen.

item.title: Mac owners in the US can now extend their warranty beyond three years
item.description: The ongoing coverage will continue to renew annually until a customer cancels it.

item.title: The new 'Mortal Kombat' movie isn't just about the violence
item.description: Screenwriter Greg Russo says he intentionally injected some levity, for old time's sake.

item.title: Senators want to block government agencies from buying Clearview AI data
item.description: A bipartisan bill would also ban purchases of location data without a warrant.

item.title: Two formerly Japan-only 'Ace Attorney' games are finally being released in English
item.description: Warm up your arguing voice and limber your objection fingers, there's a new Ace Attorney game coming to town.

item.title: Free-to-play Xbox games no longer require Xbox Live Gold to play online
item.description: Starting today, all Xbox One and Xbox Series X/S owners can play free online multiplayer games without an Xbox Live Gold membership.

item.title: European Commission proposes strict policies to govern AI use
item.description: As governments around the world consider how to regulate AI, the European Union is planning first-of-its-kind legislation that would put strict limits on the technology.

item.title: OnePlus Watch is getting an always-on display after abysmal reviews
item.description: OnePlus is rolling out an update that should improve activity tracking.

item.title: The third Android 12 developer preview improves haptics and in-app links
item.description: This preview adds haptic feedback options for developers, new app launch animations and improved link management in apps, which are features we expect to arrive in the next major version of Android.

item.title: Magic Leap 2 is coming later this year, says CEO Peggy Johnson
item.description: The business-focused headset will be generally available to buy in early 2022.

item.title: Background replacement videos are coming to Google Meet
item.description: Along with other updates, you'll have more control over how you see your own feed.
